description.plain:
Born on February 11, 1998, Khalid (Full name: Khalid Donnel Robinson) became a prominent R&B artist from El Paso, Texas, after Kylie Jenner featured his 2016 hit “Location” on her Snapchat. Khalid’s music seemingly boosted into the mainstream, he signed to RCA Records only months after graduating high school, and he released his debut album, American Teen on March 3, 2017. The album included the two successful singles, the aforementioned “Location,” “Young Dumb & Broke,” and another single “Saved.”

On September 14, 2018, Khalid released his next project, an EP titled Suncity, in relation to El Paso’s nickname. Khalid would follow this up with his second studio album, Free Spirit, which was released on April 5, 2019.

body.plain:
Born on February 11, 1998, Khalid (Full name: Khalid Donnel Robinson) became a prominent R&B artist from El Paso, Texas, after Kylie Jenner featured his 2016 hit “Location” on her Snapchat. Khalid’s music seemingly boosted into the mainstream, he signed to RCA Records only months after graduating high school, and he released his debut album, American Teen on March 3, 2017. The album included the two successful singles, the aforementioned “Location,” “Young Dumb & Broke,” and another single “Saved.”

On September 14, 2018, Khalid released his next project, an EP titled Suncity, in relation to El Paso’s nickname. Khalid would follow this up with his second studio album, Free Spirit, which was released on April 5, 2019.

description.plain:
On “1-800-273-8255,” Logic shows that suicide is never the answer to anyone’s problems. He wants people to know that there is always help available, such as the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline, whose phone number is the title of this song. In fact, the song was released in partnership with the NSPL.

In an interview with Genius, Logic said that this song details the story of someone calling the NSPL wanting to commit suicide but after a conversation with the NSPL representative,  the caller soon after decides he wants to live.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SOJTg9cL5bM

Logic teased the song various times on both Twitter and on Instagram stories as well.

[Chorus: Logic]

I just wanna die
And let me tell you why

[Verse 1: Logic]

I've been praying for somebody to save me, no one's heroic
And my life don't even matter, I know it, I know it
I know I'm hurting deep down, but can't show it
I never had a place to call my own
I never had a home, ain't nobody callin' my phone
Where you been? Where you at? What's on your mind?
They say every life precious but nobody care about mine

[Pre-Chorus: Logic]
I've been on the low, I been taking my time
I feel like I'm out of my mind
It feel like my life ain't mine (Who can relate? Woo)
I've been on the low, I been taking my time
I feel like I'm out of my mind
It feel like my life ain't mine

[Chorus: Logic]
I want you to be alive, I want you to be alive
You don't gotta die today, you don't gotta die
I want you to be alive, I want you to be alive
You don't gotta die, now let me tell you why

[Verse 2: Alessia Cara]
It's the very first breath when your head's been drowning underwater
And it's the lightness in the air when you're there chest-to-chest with a lover
It's holding on, though the road's long, seeing light in the darkest things
And when you stare at your reflection, finally knowing who it is
I know that you'll thank God you did

[Verse 3: Logic]
I know where you been, where you are, where you goin'
I know you're the reason I believe in life
What's the day without a little night?
I'm just tryna shed a little light
It can be hard
It can be so hard
But you gotta live right now
You got everything to give right now

[Pre-Chorus: Logic]
I've been on the low, I been taking my time
I feel like I'm out of my mind
It feel like my life ain't mine (Who can relate? Woo)
I've been on the low, I been taking my time
I feel like I'm out of my mind
It feel like my life ain't mine

[Chorus: Logic]
I finally wanna be alive, I finally wanna be alive
I don't wanna die today, I don't wanna die
I finally wanna be alive, I finally wanna be alive
I don't wanna die, I don't wanna die

[Outro: Khalid]
Pain don't hurt the same, I know
The lane I travel feels alone
But I'm moving 'til my legs give out
And I see my tears melt in the snow
But I don't wanna cry, I don't wanna cry anymore
I wanna feel alive, I don't even wanna die anymore
Oh, I don't wanna
I don't wanna
I don't even wanna die anymore

songs.title: Young Dumb & Broke

description.plain: “Young Dumb & Broke” finds Khalid convincing a love interest that their youth allows them to be “young” and “dumb.” Though Khalid feels like there’s no need for romantic commitment, he’s still has love to give. He shows that love can be given in many ways and that all deserve a chance for love.

songs.title: Location

description.plain:
Khalid described “Location” in an interview with Pigeons and Planes:

‘Location’ is a story of young love. The kind of love that you would travel all over the country to find. It’s just a story of searching for something that we all want in life no matter who we are and that’s a real genuine lover, but it doesn’t come easy.

The track reached a wider audience after Kylie Jenner featured it in her Snapchat story on May 27th, 2016—Khalid appreciated the boost.

songs.title: Better

description.plain:
“Better” serves as the follow up to Khalid’s previous single “OTW” which featured verses from both 6LACK and Ty Dolla $ign. Although his previous single was all about being there for a significant other, “Better” highlights the necessity for being there for each other.

On first listen this song sounds like a love song, but dive deeper and it’s about hooking up on the low, or being friends with benefits with someone and how nothing feels better than the sexual relationship that they share.

The cover art features a handwritten note:

with love, to the 915 – Khalid!

Khalid shouts out his hometown El Paso, Texas, where the area code is 915. “Better” was released the day before Khalid’s El Paso “915 Hometown Show” on September 15, 2018.

songs.title: Silence

description.plain:
A collab that Marshmello had hinted at dating back to July 22, 2017, “Silence” tells the story of someone struggling with their emotional well-being and confidence in developing relationships. As the song progresses to the chorus, Khalid expresses the strength that the storyteller has found to overcome their fears of talking and deciding to break the “silence” they’ve felt trapped in up until now.

The song peaked at #30 on the Billboard Hot 100 charts.

songs.title: Talk

description.plain:
“Talk” is the lead single from Khalid’s sophomore album. The song marks his first collaboration with electronic production duo Disclosure.

In the song, Khalid laments about a relationship moving too fast and the need for communication between both members of the relationship.

The song was teased by Khalid a day before its release and premiered on Zane Lowe’s Beats 1 Radio show:

https://twitter.com/Beats1/status/1093517780161200131?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw

songs.title: Saved

description.plain:
In a verified annotation below, Khalid disclosed that “Saved” was about a relationship he had in El Paso. His moving to New York put stress on the relationship:

We soon decided, after I moved, that the relationship wasn’t as necessary as it was. She had to find herself. I had to find myself. But at the same time, we always let each other know, “I’ll keep your number saved in case you need me. In case you need someone to talk to. If you want a conversation. If you fall for me again.” It was a sense of comfort, just by having her number. I still have her number to this day.

songs.full_title: Beautiful People by Ed Sheeran (Ft. Khalid)
songs.title: Beautiful People

description.plain:
“Beautiful People” is the third promotional single from Ed Sheeran’s No.6 Collaborations Project. The track is about remaining true to yourself and not trying to become one of those so-called “beautiful people” obsessed with material things and stature.

It opens with pretty vocal harmonies: “We are, we are, we are” floats over a winsome melody and handclap-enhanced rhythms. Sheeran and Khalid each sing a verse about uncomfortable social situations, where a person can feel “surrounded but still alone.” “We don’t fit in well/We are just ourselves."

Sheeran shared a short clip via Instagram on June 27, 2019, letting fans know that the video will drop at 3 a.m. ET Friday, three hours after the song’s midnight release.

songs.title: Coaster

description.plain: Khalid sings a somber ballad about a possible past love interest. He describes this woman he has loved. He knows that she never treated him the way he wanted to be treated and is afraid to move on without this person he will love unconditionally. Although he wants her, time passes and he realizes that he will be better without her and says he will not be there for her when she returns because he realizes now she is not the one for him.

songs.title: Youth

description.plain:
“Youth” is the third single off of Shawn Mendes' self-titled album, and his first collaboration with breakout R&B sensation Khalid. In an interview, Shawn spoke about the importance of the song and its lyrics to him:

It’s the most important song on the album… I wanted to write something but it had to be about the feeling for us as a generation when [a tragedy] happens. So I wrote a song about our youth, a feeling that can’t be taken away from us.

The song alludes to multiple terrorist attacks that occurred mid-2017 in the UK, particularly the explosion in Ariana Grande’s concert and the attack on London Bridge. The attacks caused great suffering and loss of life and left the youth of the nation in an insecure and fearful situation. Here, Shawn stand up against this.

songs.title: OTW

description.plain:
“OTW,” an acronym for “On The Way,” is a track all about being there for a significant other. Khalid, Ty Dolla $ign and 6lack all express their ability to be on call for that special someone.

The song was first teased by Khalid on March 30, 2018 in a tweet with the caption “on the way”, then announced by all three artists on the 16th of April that the song would be released on 4/20.

songs.title: Saturday Nights

description.plain:
In this song Khalid is singing about a girl who is going through tough time, has family issues and her parents don’t care. They are absent and Khalid cares about her in ways her parents don’t care/didn’t take the time to learn about her.
He could also be talking about a girl who is a stripper or an escort, with the second verse supporting such a theory by sounding like a cliché stripper story. Khalid understands her and cares despite her situation and job.

This song could also be about the negligence of her parents. They let her do whatever, and never really took time to bond with her and understand her.

songs.title: Ocean

description.plain:
“Ocean” is a collaboration between Dutch DJ & producer Martin Garrix and American rhythmic pop singer/songwriter Khalid. It marks the first pop-oriented song of Garrix’ since last year’s collaboration with David Guetta, “So Far Away”.

Diverging from Garrix’ traditional energetic style, “Ocean” places a greater emphasis on atmosphere and vocals. The most notable element of this song’s composition is the unorthodox drop, which employs more traditional, acoustic instruments in comparison to Garrix’ other synthesizer-laden work.

Lyrically, it centers on the idea that love’s power is unstoppable, and nothing can get in its way, through the metaphor of an ocean that still can’t separate the lovers.

songs.title: Suncity

description.plain:
On the title track to Suncity, Khalid and Empress Of explore a concept of escaping to El Paso, Texas, Khalid’s hometown, where his heart lies and he can leave everything behind.

This is not their first collaboration, having appeared on DJDS‘ “Why Don’t You Come On” together, a 2017 song that appeared on his 2018 album Big Wave More Fire.

songs.title: American Teen

description.plain:
On “American Teen,” Khalid sings about the joys of being a teenager having fun with friends, partying and graduating high school.

“American Teen” is the title track of Khalid’s debut album, released March 3, 2017. It’s the seventh single taken from the album.

songs.title: Electric

description.plain:
“Electric” is Alina Baraz’s first song released as a solo artist, differing from her highly successful collaborative debut EP Urban Flora with Galimatias. The song serves as the lead single of her debut full-length solo project The Color of You despite being released more than a year earlier.

This song is about a love that is burning with passion and fire to be taken into another realm through love.

songs.full_title: Homemade Dynamite (Remix) by Lorde (Ft. Khalid, Post Malone & SZA)
songs.title: Homemade Dynamite (Remix)
songs.title_with_featured: Homemade Dynamite (Remix) (Ft. Khalid, Post Malone & SZA)

description.plain:
The original “Homemade Dynamite” was about finding a relationship in a party, and the remix continues the trend. Khalid’s and Post Malone’s verses, similar to Lorde’s verses on the original, are about getting to know someone at a party while intoxicated, while SZA’s verse is about getting drunk and stealing someone else’s lover.

The stacked remix was initially teased on Lorde’s Twitter on September 13, 2017, just two and a half weeks after her memorable VMA performance of the original. It was officially released the next day, two weeks before she began the European leg of her Melodrama tour, which featured Khalid as an opening act.

https://twitter.com/lorde/status/908105273784418304

Much like the release of this song, Lorde released a remix to “Supercut” that featured Run the Jewels the day before Lorde began the North American leg of her Melodrama tour, which was also supported by Run the Jewels.

songs.recording_location: Conway Recording Studios, Los Angeles, CA, USA / Electric Lady Studios, New York, NY, USA

songs.title: Therapy

description.plain:
Khalid simultaneously compares a girl’s love to “drugs” and “therapy,” painting it as a relaxing escape in more ways than one. Whilst it seems the rest of life may be getting him down, she’s his “therapy,” or the means by which he helps himself cope.

Like on “Young, Dumb and Broke,” Khalid admits that he’s “not one for relationships.” Despite this, he stills “needs [her] therapy.”

songs.full_title: Another Sad Love Song by Khalid
songs.title: Another Sad Love Song

description.plain:
“Another Sad Love Song” is Khalid trying to “get over how it all went wrong.”

Using the classic images of ‘turning tables’ and ‘burning bridges,’ Khalid cryptically outlines the disintegration of a relationship. It seems that he might be at fault – he references his emotional unavailability as something that played a role in their break up.

songs.title: Shot Down

description.plain:
The track is a classic love song in which Khalid laments the hurt that love’s caused him.

“Shot Down” was released on February 3rd, a promotional single for Texas-native’s then-upcoming debut album, American Teen.

songs.title: Angels

description.plain: Khalid appeals to the image of angels to illustrate divine intervention in his life. In his times of despair, the angels help him get by – now that he knows they’re there, he’s confident that they’ll help him find “better days.”

songs.title: Reasons

description.plain:
“Reason” is Khalid’s first single that has not been released under an album. His other 2016 singles such as, “Let’s Go,” “Hopeless,” and “Coaster,” were all released on his debut album American Teen.

The track explores reasons for loving a girl. Khalid explains that this girl deserves all of his love because she gives him multiple reasons to love her.

songs.title: Cold Blooded

description.plain:
“Cold Blooded” finds Khalid heartbroken. He’s given his heart to a girl who’s treated it poorly, but he’s unwilling to take it back – whilst he wants an explanation, he also wants her just as much as he did before.

He’s “cold blooded” – without his heart, he needs her contact to sustain his life. Without touching each other, he wouldn’t be able to sustain his body temperature, much like cold blooded animals (such as lizards).

songs.title: My Bad

description.plain:
“My Bad” is the third official single from Khalid’s second studio album Free Spirit, released on March 7, 2019.

The song deals with a similar theme to the one from the previous single, “Talk,” as there are still problems of communication between Khalid and his lover. However, this time, arguments have worsened and he seems tired of facing these difficulties.

songs.title: Vertigo

description.plain: Vertigo is an auto-reflection of Khalid analyzing the mess his life has been. It includes multiple questions which stimulate himself to think and the audience to think about their own journeys. In this new album “Suncity”, Khalid focusing on looking into his background and the path he took which lead him to where he is now.

songs.title: Eleven

description.plain:
“Eleven” is expected to be the second single from Khalid’s upcoming third studio album. He first teased the track on Twitter and Instagram on January 7, 2020, two days before its release.

The track is all about driving with a significant other, and is over a slow, acoustic-centered instrumental. Khalid croons to his significant other about their relationship, as well as asking about her feelings for him.

songs.title: Floating

description.plain: On “Floating”, Alina partners with Khalid, whom she previously collaborated with on “Electric”. The pair produce another sultry, R&B track. Sonically, this track fits its title perfectly, as the downtempo electronica beats pair with Alina and Khalid’s soothing vocals to create a light and feathery track.

songs.title: Let’s Go

description.plain:
“Let’s Go” highlights the freedoms of youth and recklessness that American Teen is all about.

It emphasizes the ideas of setting free and just going wherever the world takes you.

songs.embed_content: Read “Let's Go” by Khalid on Genius

songs.title: Motion

description.plain:
Khalid’s first EP, Suncity, dropping in October 29, 2018, “Motion” describes a teen relationship similar to his past love songs in his debut studio album, American Teen.

In this song, Khalid talks about loving his mate deeply, despite having a rough start in the relationship.

description.plain: “As I am” is a song by Justin Bieber. The title was spotted in Justin Bieber’s YouTube exclusive Documentary, Justin Bieber: Next Chapter, as we see the singer deciding the supposed tracklist for his next album in the studio. Confirmed singles like “Anyone” and “Lonely” can be seen listed on the song board.

songs.title: Bad Luck

description.plain:
Bad Luck is nothing Khalid is unfamiliar with, this he confirms in the song from his latest album under the same name. “Bad Luck” speaks about Khalid’s constant troubles with unfortnate relashionships that hurts his soul.
The interesting song is extremely catchy and the chorus stays on your mind for almost an eternity, however, is that bad luck or not?

songs.title: Self

description.plain:
“Self” is the fourth official single from Khalid’s second studio album. It follows “My Bad” which was released earlier in the month.

The introspective song finds Khalid in a self-reflecting mode as he addresses his anxieties, fears, insecurities and working to make himself a better person.

He announced the songs release through a tweet, revealing the title, it’s number on the album’s tracklist and release date along with the cover photo.
https://twitter.com/thegreatkhalid/status/1110293680986820608?s=20

songs.title: Free Spirit

description.plain:
“Free Spirit” is the title track of Khalid’s Sophomore album, which was released on April 5, 2019.

On “Free Spirit, Khalid is ready to let go of all of his worries and live his life in its purest form, and he invites someone around him to do the same.

songs.title: Hundred

description.plain:
“Hundred” is the ninth track of Free Spirit, and the
message behind the song is for listeners to keep themselves composed and focused throughout the numerous concerns we face in life. And the word hundred, which serves as the title of the track, is used in different contexts throughout the song.

Primarily to describe the multitude of aforementioned obligations Khalid, in particular, has to deal with. And as such, he is not privy to give in to distractions.

Amongst these potential setbacks are friends and other people who do not have Khalid’s best interests in mind. But ultimately he does not let such interactions knock him off balance. Instead, he stays focused on the hundred things (he has to) do today while simultaneously acknowledging that circumstances will not always be ideal.

songs.title: Don’t Pretend

description.plain:
“Don’t Pretend” is the sixth official release from Khalid’s second studio album Free Spirit, released on April 5th, 2019.

The track was released just two days prior to the album’s release, with fans around the world having the opportunity to hear the full album earlier by watching the ‘Free Spirit’ short film in select cinemas on the same day.

songs.title: Intro

description.plain: ‘Intro’ is Khalid’s induction to the 2019 album ‘Free Spirit’. Khalid describes a relationship that he is clinging to, despite the fact that it is clearly not working out, because he doesn’t know who he is outside of it and is terrified of facing the world outside of the safe, secure context of a relationship.

songs.title: Alive

description.plain:
On “Alive,” Khalid reflects on this transition period in his life as he grows from not only a teenager to a young adult, but from an aspiring artist to a superstar. Keeping his thoughts and feelings to himself throughout these changes has taken its toll on him.

Looking ahead to what is still to come, he looks to improve his state of mind.

description.plain:
Three months after the successful release of his debut album American Teen, Khalid links up with Lil Yachty and Rae Sremmurd for an unexpected remix.

With each artist being 25 or younger, they all could share their experiences with living life as a young person in this society. Swae Lee and Lil Yachty specifically express how their come ups pushed them past the “Young, Dumb & Broke” lifestyle.

songs.title: Paradise

description.plain:
Paradise is the eighth track on Khalid’s Sophomore album Free Spirit.

The song explains how Khalid and his lover’s “Free Spirit” attitude is effecting their relationship. They pray to repent from their wickedness only to fall back into their old ways. But their love will make it through the hard times.

songs.full_title: Don’t Let Me Down by Sabrina Claudio (Ft. Khalid)
songs.title: Don’t Let Me Down

description.plain:
“Don’t Let Me Down” is Claudio’s second single, after “All To You”, released on April 4 2018. This time, the track is a duet with soulful vocals from fellow up-and-coming R&B singer Khalid.

Both artists contributed to the song’s lyrics, while Sad Money produced it.

The song was originally accompanied by a music video, with both Sabrina and Khalid posting snippets of it to their social medias to promote the release. However, the video was scrapped last minute after racially insensitive tweets from Sabrina surfaced online. Since the allegations, Khalid has unfollowed Sabrina on all social medias and both singers have removed all promotional posts from their Instagrams.

songs.title: Heaven

description.plain: Heaven is almost Khalid’s last song on the album. It ties perfectly into the previous song “Alive” in which he talks about dying in order to be alive. In this song, Khalid talks about losing someone close to him, perhaps a significant other or best friend. Although it’s never explicitly stated whether or not this individual is physically taken from the world or is just no longer friends with Khalid. Regardless, Khalid is crushed, and he shows it in this song. He speaks in a helpless kind of tone, saying that this is it. He says that he’s ready for heaven to take him away, that there’s nothing left for him. This is probably his most dramatic difference of Free Spirit Khalid from American Teen Khalid

songs.title: Hurts 2B Human

description.plain:
Hurts 2B Human is P!nk’s fourth single and the title track of her eighth studio album Hurts 2B Human. It was released four days before the album.

The song was accidentally uploaded circa April 12 2019 on Spotify with its stated release date as April 22, 2018.

songs.full_title: Caught Up by Majid Jordan (Ft. Khalid)
songs.title: Caught Up

description.plain:
OVO Sound’s Majid Jordan are back with new music and a stunning video for “Caught Up” feat. Khalid.

Last week Khalid teased a collaboration with OVO’s Majid Jordan with one simple tweet detailing how he “can’t wait.” Now just seven days later, the single is finally here. The song is an expected offering and vibe from Majid Al Maskati and Jordan Ullman – a steady low tempo vocal coming from Majid with the Jordan-finessed production.

Khalid comes in perfectly, with lyrical content about getting caught up in the fast life of Los Angeles and buying nice cars that don’t even get driven.

songs.title: Twenty One

description.plain:
21, a detrimental age and of course the title of one of Khalid’s new song. This song does not handle the greatness and joyfulness of turning 21, but the eventual sorrows. The song provides a contrast from Khalid’s 8TEEN released just 2 years earlier.

A well appreciated contrast to the rest of the album that just increases the width and depth of the album.

songs.full_title: Too Gone by Rich The Kid (Ft. Khalid)
songs.title: Too Gone

description.plain:
Rich The Kid recruits singer Khalid for track #5 of his debut studio album, The World Is Yours. Unlike majority of the other tracks on this project, this one is rather moody.

While Khalid utilizes his parts in the choruses to sing about being mentally “out of it” from his consumption of alcohol, RTK instead raps about the unnamed woman and why he chooses not to call her back.

The Rich Forever CEO previewed a snippet of this song, and later confirmed its release date through his Instagram page in April of 2017.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=okNnhk5OCYw

songs.title: Salem’s Interlude

description.plain: Salem’s Interlude is the fourth track on Suncity. This dialogue explores Khalid’s fears, where he is going with his life, and his happiness.

songs.embed_content: Read “Salem's Interlude” by Khalid on Genius

body.plain: Salem’s Interlude is the fourth track on Suncity. This dialogue explores Khalid’s fears, where he is going with his life, and his happiness.

songs.lyrics:
[Dialogue]
I think I'm fearful of things like traveling
I'm fearful of failure
I'm fearful of being embarrassed
Things like that, I think hinder me from doing the best that I can sometimes
But I think that if I learn to be less fearful
I would get further
I feel like I'm not always in the correct direction
Even though I know I'm on the right path
I'm like "I'm on the right path"
But am I walking the right way, or should I be turning around?
Like little things like that that I go back and forth about in my head
And I think it's always nice to have reassurance
I think it's really nice to see how far being a genuine person can get you
For me at least, like I think that's the reason that I am where I am
I think that I am a big mix of all the people around me
And I'm just happy
I can't complain about anything
Oh yeah
That I'm trying to get so motherfucking high, nigga
I don't wanna feel nothing (Wait, what?)

songs.title: Trippin’

description.plain:
The song revolves around the use of several kinds of drugs, from weed to acid. While Buddy goes for a harder flow, the hook sung by Khalid feels somehow nostalgic and almost depressed.

This could allude to the mind state of a person who is compulsively using drugs. Because of a difficult life, one might choose to revolve to drugs to feel better and confident. However, after the comedown, an addicted person will probably feel worse than before.

songs.title: Eleven (Remix)

description.plain:
This is the remix of “Eleven” which is expected to be the second single from Khalid’s upcoming third studio album. He first teased the track on Twitter and Instagram on January 7, 2020, two days before its release.
Khalid decided to shoot the music video for the remix with Summer Walker.
The track is all about driving with a significant other, and is over a slow, acoustic-centered instrumental. Khalid croons to his significant other about their relationship, as well as asking about her feelings for him.

songs.full_title: Why Don't You Come On by DJDS (Ft. Empress Of & Khalid)
songs.title: Why Don’t You Come On
songs.title_with_featured: Why Don't You Come On (Ft. Empress Of & Khalid)

description.plain:
“Why Don’t You Come On” is an immediate earworm, a positive plea for peace and togetherness, exalted by the twin vocals of the Texan teen sensation Khalid and the L.A. wunderkind Empress Of.

Khalid plays headliner here: His voice is a gritty baritone that lays down the track’s backbone, making room for Empress Of’s saintly high notes. DJDS possess the confidence and playfulness to juxtapose these two starkly opposing styles with ease: the minimal drum and synth rhythms that skitter around them complement both Khalid’s yearning voice and Empress Of’s angelic flow.

“Why Don’t You Come On” is an ideal cap to a scorching night, its beat as refreshing as a blast of cool air.

songs.lyrics:

Just across the border and into the city
You and I can both get jobs
Finally see what it means to be living

[Verse 3]
See my old man's got a problem
He lives with a bottle that's the way it is
Says his body's too old for working
His body's too young to look like his
My momma went off and left him

I-I had a feeling that I belonged

I always hoped for better

I got no plans I ain't going nowhere
So take your fast car and keep on driving

[Chorus]

songs.lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Yeah, I'd rather be a lover than a fighter (fighter)
'Cause all my life, I've been fighting
Never felt a feeling of comfort
All this time, I've been hiding
And I never had someone to call my own, oh nah
I'm so used to sharing
Love only left me alone
But I'm at one with the silence

[Chorus]
I found peace in your violence
Can't tell me there's no point in trying
I found peace in your violence
Can't tell me there's no point in trying
I found peace in your violence
Can't tell me there's no point in trying
I found peace in your violence
And I've been silent for too long

[Verse 2]
I'm in need of a savior, but I'm not asking for favors
My whole life, I've felt like a burden
I think too much, and I hate it
I'm so used to being in the wrong, I'm tired of caring
Loving never gave me a home, so I'll sit here in the silence

[Chorus]
I found peace in your violence
Can't tell me there's no point in trying
I found peace in your violence
Can't tell me there's no point in trying
I found peace in your violence
Can't tell me there's no point in trying
I found peace in your violence
And I've been silent for too long

body.plain: Ricky Remedy’s remix of “lovely” is an atmospheric, quick paced rework of Eilish and Khalid’s original haunting track— featuring bombastic drops, electronic elements, and alternate vocal mixing.

songs.lyrics:
[Intro]
Ricky Remedy, yeah

[Verse 1: Billie Eilish & Khalid]
Thought I found a way
Thought I found a way out (Found)
But you never go away (Never go away)
So I guess I gotta stay now

[Pre-Chorus: Billie Eilish & Khalid]
Oh, I hope some day I'll make it out of here
Even if it takes all night or a hundred years
Need a place to hide, but I can't find one near
Wanna feel alive, outside I can't fight my fear

[Chorus: Billie Eilish with Khalid]
Isn't it lovely, all alone
Heart made of glass, my mind of stone
Tear me to pieces, skin to bone
Hello, welcome home

[Verse 2: Khalid with Billie Eilish]
Walking out of time
Looking for a better place (Looking for a better place)
Something's on my mind
Always in my head space

[Pre-Chorus: Billie Eilish & Khalid]
But I know someday I'll make it out of here
Even if it takes all night or a hundred years
Need a place to hide, but I can't find one near
Wanna feel alive, outside I can't fight my fear

[Chorus: Billie Eilish with Khalid]
Isn't it lovely, all alone
Heart made of glass, my mind of stone
Tear me to pieces, skin to bone
Hello, welcome home

[Outro: Khalid, Billie Eilish, Khalid & Billie Eilish]
Woah, yeah
Yeah, ah
Woah, woah
Hello, welcome home

Move me, take me from this place

Speeding up my heartbeat, playing in the flames

[Chorus: Alina Baraz]
Kiss me, we're on fire, babe
Love me, take me to outer space
Kiss me, we're on fire, babe
Love me, take me to outer space

[Verse 2: Khalid]

Submitted under power and you brought me to my knees

Love me, take me to outer space

Love me, take me to outer space
Kiss me, (we're on fire...)

songs.title: Terug

songs.lyrics:
[FMA]
Schuif de mengtafel open, want Passie Posse is binnen
Warm it up jaaa, we gaan lekker springen
Praat niet over comeback, ga niet zo beginnen
We gaan de boel verzamelen, ja echt innen
R: Oooh, geef me die mic, ik kan 't niet laten
F: Die lange DJ wil ff wat praten
L: We brengen het Woord terug naar de straten
R: Terug naar de oldskool, ga terug naar af
F: Gebruik de bijbel als enige maatstaf
L: Dus terug naar basis zoals ik al aangaf
R: Terug met een boodschap, terug op de mic
F: Ja, Jezus stierf ? voor jou ? voor mij
L: Maar 3 dagen later kwam Hij terug uit het dodenrijk
R: Nu ? is ? Hij ? terug naar de Vader
F: Maar ooit komt Hij terug, ja, hier op aarde
L: Ja, ooit komt Hij terug, om ons te halen
R: Ja, ooit komt hij terug, dus zorg dat je klaar bent!
F: Ja, ken je Hem niet? Weet dat God je naam kent
L: Ken de kracht van gebed als je dat aanwend
R: De dag dat Hij terugkomt, geeft me geen zorgen
F: Misschien vandaag nog, misschien ook morgen
L: Misschien over 10 jaar, de datum verborgen
R: Ik doe geen voorspelling, maar luister wat ik scandeer
F: ?Gelijk de dagen van Noach?, dat is wat ik hanteer
L: De tekenen zijn duidelijk, het duurt niet zo lang meer!
R: PP met nog steeds dezelfde visie
F: Met ?Terug? als titel handelen wij in de precisie
L: De beat is zo dik, dat is mijn conclusie
R: Sneller ? Feller ? Vetter dan ooit
F: De tijd wel even stil ? niet weggegooid
L: Nu niet meer stil, onze talenten ontplooid
R: Passie Posse doet zijn naam eer aan
F: Met het tweesnijdend zwaard de zonde neerslaan
L: Met het schild van geloof vurige pijlen weerstaan
R: Wij ? zijn ? terug op het podium
F: We zijn terug, en doper dan opium
L: Terug met woorden die jou prikken als jodium
R: Wij zijn terug, zeker terug in de strijd
F: Cap op mijn hoofd, in m'n linkerhand de mic
L: Olie in m'n lamp, gericht op het koninkrijk!
R: Terug om God Z'n naam te verkondigen
F: Terug om het te laten bliksemen en donderen
L: Terug met de boodschap over wonderen!

[BREAK]
Terug! Terug! Terug!
Bring that back one more time... Bring that beat back!
Bring that beat back! Bring that beat back!
You wanna hear that beat, right? Bring that beat back!
Bring that sh*t back, 1-2-3-4, Hit it!

[PART 2]
R: Er komen velen die zeggen, ik ben de Christus
F: Maar laat je niet misleiden, het is een list, dus
L: Hou vast aan 't Woord, het is geen circus!
R: Hongersnood en aardbevingen, bergen die scheuren
F: Koninkrijk na koninkrijk, moet het betreuren
L: Er zijn oorlogen en rampen, maar dat moet eerst gebeuren
R: Het is nog niet het einde, dus wees niet bevreest
F: Maar de duivel die weet: hij is er geweest
L: De laatste loodjes: hij gaat tekeer als 'n beest
R: 1948: Isra?l een staat
F: De Joden keren terug, vinden daar hun toeverlaat
L: Wees radikaal voor Jezus, je zal worden gehaat
R: Mahmoud Ahmadinejad, hij moest 't 'ns weten
F: ?Veeg Israel van de kaart?, en dat soort kreten
L: 't Zijn woorden die voorzegt zijn door de profeten
R: Valse profeten zullen velen verleiden
F: Liefde zal verkoelen, laat je niet misleiden!
L: Geloof ze niet, 't zijn de tekenen der tijden!
R: Maar geloof me niet als ik zeg dat dit het einde is!
F: Van 't oosten tot 't westen, een grote bliksemflits!
L: En heel de wereld zal weten wie Jezus is!
R: Geen tijd om te slapen, wordt wakker! wordt wakker!
F: De vijand zaait z'n zaad op de akker
L: Dus wees alert, wees sterk en dapper
R: De Koning komt, dit is het uur
F: Zijn ogen zijn een brandend vuur
L: Zijn kleden wit, zo rijn en puur
R: De bruiloft van het Lam, blijf het verwachten!
F: Als Hij komt om ons te halen, blijf dan niet achter!
L: Geloof, hoop en liefde, hou dat in je gedachten!
R: Alle christenen weg, dat drukt z'n stempel
F: De grote verdrukking komt wis en warempel
L: Na de gruwel der verwoesting, in de derde tempel
R: Een hoop van ellende, maar wordt niet ontmoedigd
F: De genade van Jezus is zo overvloedig
L: Maranatha!!! Jezus kom spoedig!

[BUSYR]
En Hij zal Zijn engelen uitzenden onder luid bazuingeschal
En zij zullen Zijn uitverkorenen bijeenbrengen uit de vier windstreken
